00013 /* One-dimensional first derivative functions: Functions to calculate the
00014  * finite-difference approximation to the first derivative along a given 
00015  * dimension at the cell-centers / grid points.
00016  *
00017  * Arguments:-
00018  *  
00019  *  Df        double*     array containing the approximation to the first derivative
00020  *                        (1D array representing an n-D solution)
00021  *
00022  *  f         double*     array containing the function whose first derivative is to
00023  *                        be computed.
00024  *                        (1D array representing an n-D solution)
00025  *
00026  *  dir       int         dimension (x/y/z/...) along which to compute the first derivative
00027  *
00028  *  bias      int         forward or backward differencing for odd-ordered approximations
00029  *                        (-1: backward, 1: forward)
00030  *
00031  *  s         void*       pointer to an object providing the solver context. The object must
00032  *                        contain at least the following:
00033  *                        ndims     int       number of dimensions
00034  *                        nvars     int       number of elements at each grid location
00035  *                        dim       int*      array of grid size along each dimension 
00036  *                                            (integer array of size ndims)
00037  *                        ghosts    int       number of ghost points
00038  *
00039  *  m         void*       Pointer to an object providing the MPI context. Current not being 
00040  *                        used. This will be required for compact finite-difference methods.
00041  *
00042  *
00043  * Notes:
00044  *
00045  *  + The first derivative is computed at the ghost points too. Thus, biased schemes are used
00046  *    at and near the boundaries.
00047 */
00048 
00049 int FirstDerivativeFirstOrder         (double*,double*,int,int,void*,void*); 
00050 int FirstDerivativeSecondOrderCentral (double*,double*,int,int,void*,void*); 
00051 int FirstDerivativeFourthOrderCentral (double*,double*,int,int,void*,void*);
